title: Apple Safari RenderElement Use-After-Free Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
description:
This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on vulnerable installations of Apple Safari. User interaction is required to exploit this vulnerability in that the target must visit a malicious page or open a malicious file.
The specific flaw exists within the handling of RenderElement objects. The issue results from the lack of validating the existence of an object prior to performing operations on the object. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code under the context of the current process.
timeline:
2017-03-09 - Vulnerability reported to vendor
2017-05-15 - Coordinated public release of advisory
credit: Zheng Huang of the Baidu Security Lab
